title: Peach Bowl Livestream: How to Watch Arizona State vs. Texas Online
description: Arizona State and Texas face off Wednesday at the Peach Bowl in the first-ever College Football Playoff Quarterfinals. Here’s everything you need to know for streaming the Peach Bowl online for free. How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online: Stream Arizona State vs. Texas The quarterfinal game aka the Peach Bowl kicks off at 1 […]
author: Claire Franken
excerpt: The Peach Bowl kicks off at 1 pm ET Wednesday, Jan. 1 from Atlanta — here's how to stream the Arizona State vs. Texas college football game online.
text: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, TVLine may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Arizona State and Texas face off Wednesday at the Peach Bowl in the first-ever College Football Playoff Quarterfinals. Here’s everything you need to know for streaming the Peach Bowl online for free. How to Watch Arizona State vs. Texas College Football Game Online How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online: Stream Arizona State vs. Texas The quarterfinal game aka the Peach Bowl kicks off at 1 pm ET this Wednesday, Jan. 1, and will be broadcast on ESPN. And good news! There are plenty of ways to watch ESPN online for free — you just need to find a platform that offers free trials. Below we’ve outlined all of the ways to watch the Peach Bowl and listed which live-TV streaming services offer free trial periods for cost-free viewing. Using a free trial to watch the Peach Bowl is your best way for watching Arizona State vs. Texas online free — simply cancel the subscription once the game is over! How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online Free: Sling TV Sling TV is one of the most affordable cord-cutting options for accessing ESPN. The service offers three subscriptions with different channel lineups, but we recommend the Sling Orange plan for $40/month, since it includes ESPN. With Sling, you can’t watch the Peach Bowl for free since there’s no free trial period. But if you act fast, you can subscribe to Sling for just $20 because the service is offering new users half off their first month! In terms of live-TV streaming services, this is the cheapest way to watch the Arizona State vs. Texas game online without cable. Courtesy of Sling TV Free Trial: N/A Price: $40/month $20/month Device Availability: AirTV, Amazon Fire TV, Android, Android TV, Apple TV, Chromecast, Cox, Google Nest, iOS, LG TV, Roku, Samsung TV, TiVo, Vizio, Windows 10, Windows 11, Xbox, Xfinity Channel Lineup: A&E, AMC, AXS TV, BBC America, BET, Bloomberg Television, Cartoon Network, Charge!, CNN, Comedy Central, Comet, Disney Channel, ESPN, ESPN2, ESPN3, Food Network, Freeform, Fuse, HGTV, History Channel, IFC, Investigation Discovery, Lifetime, Local Now, MGM+ Drive-In, MotorTrend, Nick Jr., QVC, TBS, TNT, Travel Channel, Vice How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online Free: DirecTV Stream DirecTV Stream offers a five-day free trial so you can watch the Arizona State vs. Texas football game online for free! We recommend signing up for the Choice package, which includes ESPN. DirecTV is offering $20 off for your first three months, bringing the cost down to $94.99/month. The plan will automatically renew at its regular price of $114.99/month. But remember, you can watch the Peach Bowl for free with this plan if you cancel the subscription before the five-day trial ends. Date, Start Time The 2025 Chik-fil-A Peach Bowl game between the Arizona State Sun Devils and Texas Longhorns kicks off at 1 pm ET on Wednesday, Jan 1 from Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta. The game will be televised on ESPN. Whoever wins will move on to play in the semifinal game, playing the winner of the Rose Bowl, either No. 1 Oregon or No. 8 Ohio State for a chance to move on to the National Championship on Monday, Jan. 20. Arizona State vs. Texas Odds, Prediction The quarterfinal match-up between No. 4 Arizona State and No. 5 Texas has oddsmakers giving the Longhorns an advantage to win in a -13.5-point spread.

Arizona State and Texas face off Wednesday at the Peach Bowl in the first-ever College Football Playoff Quarterfinals. Here’s everything you need to know for streaming the Peach Bowl online for free.

How to Watch Arizona State vs. Texas College Football Game Online

How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online: Stream Arizona State vs. Texas

The quarterfinal game aka the Peach Bowl kicks off at 1 pm ET this Wednesday, Jan. 1, and will be broadcast on ESPN. And good news! There are plenty of ways to watch ESPN online for free — you just need to find a platform that offers free trials. Below we’ve outlined all of the ways to watch the Peach Bowl and listed which live-TV streaming services offer free trial periods for cost-free viewing. Using a free trial to watch the Peach Bowl is your best way for watching Arizona State vs. Texas online free — simply cancel the subscription once the game is over!

How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online Free: Sling TV

Sling TV is one of the most affordable cord-cutting options for accessing ESPN. The service offers three subscriptions with different channel lineups, but we recommend the Sling Orange plan for $40/month, since it includes ESPN. With Sling, you can’t watch the Peach Bowl for free since there’s no free trial period. But if you act fast, you can subscribe to Sling for just $20 because the service is offering new users half off their first month! In terms of live-TV streaming services, this is the cheapest way to watch the Arizona State vs. Texas game online without cable.

  • Free Trial: N/A
  • Price: $40/month $20/month
  • Device Availability: AirTV, Amazon Fire TV, Android, Android TV, Apple TV, Chromecast, Cox, Google Nest, iOS, LG TV, Roku, Samsung TV, TiVo, Vizio, Windows 10, Windows 11, Xbox, Xfinity
  • Channel Lineup: A&E, AMC, AXS TV, BBC America, BET, Bloomberg Television, Cartoon Network, Charge!, CNN, Comedy Central, Comet, Disney Channel, ESPN, ESPN2, ESPN3, Food Network, Freeform, Fuse, HGTV, History Channel, IFC, Investigation Discovery, Lifetime, Local Now, MGM+ Drive-In, MotorTrend, Nick Jr., QVC, TBS, TNT, Travel Channel, Vice

How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online Free: DirecTV Stream

DirecTV Stream offers a five-day free trial so you can watch the Arizona State vs. Texas football game online for free! We recommend signing up for the Choice package, which includes ESPN. DirecTV is offering $20 off for your first three months, bringing the cost down to $94.99/month. The plan will automatically renew at its regular price of $114.99/month. But remember, you can watch the Peach Bowl for free with this plan if you cancel the subscription before the five-day trial ends.

How to Watch the Peach Bowl Online Free: Fubo TV

Looking for how to watch the Peach Bowl for free? Fubo has you covered. The live-TV streaming service offers new users a seven-day free trial and its Pro plan grants subscribers access to ESPN. You get over 175 other channels — including the NFL Network and the CBS Sports Network — and the plan usually costs $79.99/month but is on sale for $30 off. More good news? You can cancel and change your plan at any time, making Fubo an easy and low-commitment way for watching the Peach Bowl online for free.

When is the 2025 Peach Bowl? Date, Start Time

The 2025 Chik-fil-A Peach Bowl game between the Arizona State Sun Devils and Texas Longhorns kicks off at 1 pm ET on Wednesday, Jan 1 from Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta. The game will be televised on ESPN. Whoever wins will move on to play in the semifinal game, playing the winner of the Rose Bowl, either No. 1 Oregon or No. 8 Ohio State for a chance to move on to the National Championship on Monday, Jan. 20.

Arizona State vs. Texas Odds, Prediction

The quarterfinal match-up between No. 4 Arizona State and No. 5 Texas has oddsmakers giving the Longhorns an advantage to win in a -13.5-point spread.
